metadata.synopsis: A confused merchant still lingers by the House of Grief after his unburdening (he came for grief counseling, only to have his memories stolen). Players can learn he is missing memories as a clue towards the House of Grief's true purpose.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to the House of Grief2. Talk to Arves

19.speaker: Arves
19.text: I think I should be quite happy, living in a tree. Greenery and birdsong all around.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The man is gazing upwards at the bough of a tree, a serene, dazed expression on his face.

26.speaker: Arves
26.text: Quite the life, leaping from branch to branch without a care in the world...
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: The man is gazing upwards at the bough of a tree, a serene, dazed expression on his face.

57.speaker: Arves
57.text: Wonderful little beast... nimble as anything!
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: The man is gazing upwards at the bough of a tree, a serene, dazed expression on his face.

43.speaker: Arves
43.text: There was a squirrel in the tree. Marvellous creature. Inquisitive and nut-crazed!

81.speaker: Player
81.text: You're fawning over some tree-vermin? Perhaps you've taken too much sun, or wine.

14.speaker: Arves
14.text: Hmm? Oh yes, perhaps. It's been... well, I'm not quite sure how long it's been.

27.speaker: Arves
27.text: ...You wouldn't happen to know where I live, would you?

87.speaker: Arves
87.text: I see. It must have just... slipped my mind. These things happen.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I doubt you're from around here. Who even are you?

36.speaker: Arves
36.text: I am... I am... very pleased to meet your acquaintance. And you are?

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *This is more than a lapse, you sense. Something's been done to the man's memories.*

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Do you know someone called Moyra?

69.speaker: Arves
69.text: Moyra... yes - no. I don't know. I think I remember a face. Smiling, young, then older, then ill, then...

74.speaker: Arves
74.text: No, I don't think so. You must be mistaken, friend. I don't know anyone by that name.

1.speaker: Arves
1.text: Well, I remember I was sad... but in truth, I'm not quite sure what caused it. I'm not even sure I know what sad is anymore.

64.speaker: Arves
64.text: And I came from that building over there. They were very nice to me. Seemed very helpful. Though... for the life of me, I can't recall what I was doing there in the first place.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Is there anyone you can go to? Anyone who could help?

24.speaker: Arves
24.text: There must be, you would think...

30.speaker: Arves
30.text: You know, I can swear there is someone, but their name escapes me. Hells, even their face escapes me. A figment of my imagination, perhaps.

49.speaker: Arves
49.text: It will come back to me. Or not. I'm content enough here in either case.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: See what you can learn from his thoughts.

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: What do you think you're doing?! Poking around where you don't belong - I'll show you!

72.speaker: Arves
72.text: What do you think you're doing?! Poking around where you don't belong - I'll show you!

56.text: *The man's mind is a stream of fragmented thoughts - each brushed away by another before it can take purchase...*

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *The man's mind is a stream of fragmented thoughts - each brushed away by another before it can take purchase...*

48.speaker: Arves
48.text: Marvellous day... not a care in the world. Moyra would have loved this garden. Wait, who's she...?

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Moyra sent me. She said you had money I was to bring to her - household expenses.

91.speaker: Arves
91.text: Moyra... do I know her? Yes... yes I think I do. How much does she need?

32.speaker: Arves
32.text: Moyra... do I know her? Yes... yes I think I do. How much does she need?

75.text: Who's Moyra? What household? I think you've got the wrong person, friend.

73.speaker: Arves
73.text: Who's Moyra? What household? I think you've got the wrong person, friend.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I am from the Baldurian Bank. I've come to collect interest on your debt.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I'm a debt collector. You owe me a lot of money, you know.

55.speaker: Arves
55.text: I... I do not recall this, in all honesty.

54.speaker: Arves
54.text: I... I do not recall this, in all honesty.

79.speaker: Arves
79.text: How much are we talking about...?

3.speaker: Arves
3.text: Ugh, take it. Now begone, you vulture.

28.speaker: Arves
28.text: Ugh, take it. Now away with you, carrion bird.

71.speaker: Arves
71.text: I'm afraid my purse can't quite match such a sum right now. You'll simply have to collect your gold another time.

18.speaker: Arves
18.text: I don't have that much on me.

84.speaker: Arves
84.text: I have this - I didn't want to let go of it.

6.speaker: Arves
6.text: Probably nothing important. Better to be unburdened - I think someone told me that once.

5.text: What? Preposterous! I don't even know you.

8.speaker: Arves
8.text: What? Preposterous! I don't even know you.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: You seem confused - taken a bump to the head lately, perhaps?

88.speaker: Arves
88.text: Oh no, nothing like that - I'm fit as a fiddle. It's just that certain things are... eluding me.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Do I look like I'm from around here?

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Are you feeling well? You seem... distracted.

83.speaker: Arves
83.text: Oh, just tired, I suppose. It's been quite a long day. Or at least I think it has.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: You'd get on well with someone I know called Halsin.

53.speaker: Arves
53.text: Halsin... is he of the Fayburgs? The candelabra makers?

35.speaker: Player
35.text: He's a druid, so I doubt it.

66.speaker: Arves
66.text: Hmm, perhaps it was Hagrin. Wonderful craftspeople, but truly terrible dealmakers...

7.speaker: Arves
7.text: Give it time. I had to wait for - oh, I don't even know how long - to catch a glimpse...

85.speaker: Player
85.text: While I have made friends with many a squirrel, I do not see one here.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: You either have sharper eyes than mine, or there is no squirrel here.

25.speaker: Arves
25.text: A moment... you don't happen to know where I live, do you?

58.speaker: Arves
58.text: Hmm? Oh, apologies. I was a captive audience.

20.speaker: Narrator
20.text: *A man of means, judging by his attire. He looks like a merchant or a junior council member. But right now he's without care, entranced by a tree.*

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *A man of means, judging by his attire. He looks like a merchant or a junior council member. But right now he's without care, entranced by a tree.*

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Examine the man's attire, expression - anything of note.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Look the target over, examining him.
